name: Holiday Inn Express Richmond Airport

reviews.text: My husband and I crashed with two friends for one night en route to Myrtle Beach. We got a great rate on hotwire for a two-queen room. Easy to find off the interstate. We arrived past midnight and was able to quickly get to our room to sleep for the night. Room insulation good and was very quiet. Bathroom was standard and clean, although the toilet flushed weakly. we spotted a pool and small fitness room but did not use. The next morning, we made it down to breakfast and was impressed by the spread. Self serve hot options included bacon, eggs, biscuits and gravy, as well as an on-demand pancake maker. Fruit, yogurt, and cereals also available. Overall, this was a good value. Saw a few flight crew members checking out upon leaving.
reviews.title: Road trip overnight stop

reviews.text: We needed a room after arriving in Richmond at the end of our 18 hour travel day from Europe. The hotel is near the airport and has a free shuttle. We knew we would arrive very late so we called the hotel a few days ahead and learned the shuttle procedure. When we arrived, we simply called the hotel and ten minutes later the shuttle arrived. Our check in went fast and we were given a gift bag due to our status with IHG. The room was just what we needed after a long day traveling; soft bed, quiet, and clean. Breakfast was standard self serve but was hot and plentiful; no complaints.
reviews.title: Airport Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed there for a couple of days for a business trip. Overall the hotel is good, but not as nice as other Holiday Inn Express I have stayed at. The lobby is nice, and the breakfast is pretty good. The location is nice by the airport, but the room shook from the flights coming and going. Probably the biggest fault I have with it was the bathroom looked a little run down. There were cracks in the tile grout and seemed like it could use some updating.
reviews.title: Good Hotel
Park and Fly
reviews.text: It's a pretty good hotel and is cheaper than the other hotels in its class in the area, but with the other choices in the area I'm going to try some other places before I go back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night near Richmond Airport and parked seven nights for free. Free shuttle service to and from hotel. Very convenient. We had an early morning flight, so staying at the hotel the night before the flight made prefect sense.
reviews.title: Very Convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great business-class hotel near the airport, but without the usual airport noise! The room was large and clean, and the breakfast bar outstanding! The only complaint is regarding the jacuzzi, which was luke-warm at best.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: Just stopped in without a reservation. It is very nice. I didn't like the big pillows. Otherwise, great.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.text: From the warm and friendly greeting from the two front desk folks before we even got through the door, then on to a large and clean room, with a very good breakfast set-up the next morning, no contest to make our rating Excellent. Quiet too. First rate at a very fair and reasonable price.
reviews.title: Wingate is a Winner
Very Nice Place
reviews.text: This is a very nice place to stay. I paid $55 night best place to stay in Richmond for the money. Big rooms, good free breakfast and nice pool area.

reviews.title: Good For The Price
reviews.text: The room was very large for the price. Hotel staff was friendly and helpfull. Enjoyed the pool and the sauna during the late night hours before it closed. Overall, great room for the convience and price.
